New York City is bracing for a significant winter storm this weekend, with forecasts predicting over 15 inches of snow, while heightened security measures are in place following bomb threats at NYU and ongoing negotiations in a nurses' strike.

### Risks & Alerts

- NYC could see snow as soon as early Sunday morning; up to 15+ inches expected. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- NYC ramps up operations ahead of major winter snowstorm set to pummel the area. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMipgFBVV95cUxNRUtyS0JveURWZnhTWnBTQW9zRm4zYWZlRDRLVFdIZXZ6ZU1yX3AyZWRKUmlLQ2g1RG1GUW5jRTlZSGZvU2pGdElTZDBjZGJmbGlWMnhNcXhrcUFpVXVDSzhPbDBFQlZhc01TU2N3WGgwdC1hTFBFMXVVNF91LUNNQnBPbGU0cnJiWXJacVdfeHpxNWs0VXJPdE9UU250dE9UOU85VURR?oc=5)
- NYPD providing heightened security at NYU after emailed bomb threats to two buildings. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- NYC is preparing for extreme cold snap and potential snowstorm; residents should take precautions. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMigAFBVV95cUxNRlRfanM0TWU4bWJUUl9IRjE0dF95b0JpaGprY0ZibzB2UE5wOFNTc01PWkw4T3hkMnJGcGc0bGd0UTNxalJkcl8zX3B3MTJPekFyWDVDVFhnTVlpMHZ0WnlNU2sybUVtQi1PUWpQbk1NWVNvWlJob0YwWXJ0LXBhRg?oc=5)
